Detailed Description

Object that holds the id of a callback function and aids in life cycle management of the callback.

ScopedCallback's use reference counting to manage the life cycle of the callback. Once all references to this callback go out of scope or are destroyed the Callback will be unregistered.

The ScopedCallback can be explicitly unregistered using the unregister function. Once explicitly unregistered other references to this are safe to go out of scope and have the unregister function called on them (although this will only nullify the objects).

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

sigma::core::ScopedCallback::ScopedCallback ( )
inline

Default constructor.

Constructs a new null ScopedCallback.

Note
A null ScopedCallback cannot be copied. To assign a null ScopedCallback use the assignment operator (operator=(TransientCallbackID)) with a TransientCallbackID as the right-hand operator.
sigma::core::ScopedCallback::ScopedCallback ( TransientCallbackID  transient)
inline

Constructs a new ScopedCallback from the given TransientCallbackID.

Exceptions
arc::ex::IllegalActionErrorIf a ScopedCallback has already been initialised for this callback id.
sigma::core::ScopedCallback::ScopedCallback ( const ScopedCallback &  other)
inline

Copy constructor.

Makes a copy of the given ScopedCallback and increases the reference counter.

Exceptions
arc::ex::IllegalActionErrorIf the other ScopedCallback to copy from is a null ScopedCallback.

Member Function Documentation

ScopedCallback& sigma::core::ScopedCallback::operator= ( TransientCallbackID  transient)
inline

TransientCallbackID assignment operator.

Assigns the data from the given TransientCallbackID to this ScopedCallback.

Note
This can only be performed on null ScopedCallbacks.
Exceptions
arc::ex::IllegalActionErrorIf a ScopedCallback has already been initialised for this callback id. Or if this is not a null ScopedCallback.
bool sigma::core::ScopedCallback::is_null ( ) const
inline

Returns whether this is a null ScopedCallback.

Null ScopedCallbacks cannot be copied and must be assigned using the assignment operator with a TransientCallbackID as the right-hand value.

bool sigma::core::ScopedCallback::is_registered ( ) const
inline

Returns whether this contains a registered callback or not.

A callback may return as unregistered because:

  • unregister() has been explicitly called.
  • The CallbackHandler/CallbackInterface this was registered with has been destroyed.
void sigma::core::ScopedCallback::unregister ( )
inline

Explicitly unregisters this callback.

Once the callback has been unregistered the function this is associated with will no longer be called when the CallbackHandler is triggered and this will become a null ScopedCallback.

Exceptions
arc::ex::IllegalActionErrorIf this is called on a null ScopedCallbackId.
